action.action-desc: Mr. Lampson introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide for the eligibility of reserve component members supporting contingency operations for educational assistance based on cumulative days of active duty service.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Guard and Reserve Active Duty Higher Education Act.

section.header: Eligibility of reserve component members supporting contingency operations for educational assistance based on cumulative days of active duty service

subsection.text: Section 16162(c)(4) of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 90 consecutive days and inserting 90 cumulative days; and
by striking one continuous year and inserting 365 cumulative days; and
striking two continuous years and inserting 730 cumulative days; and

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C) by striking two continuous years and inserting 730 cumulative days.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to educational assistance paid for months beginning on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
